definition: deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: Also the Kui gets thus, otherwise, really fear that that horse will accept to can not stand them.
sentences.chinese: 也虧得如此，不然，真怕那匹馬會承受不了他們。

sentences.english: First, people have more to lose.
Thanks to everybody's help, we finished the job on time.
sentences.chinese: 虧得大家幫忙，我們才按時把這活幹完。

sentences.english: Back in time scold go jin jing kui tang sugar.
sentences.chinese: 虧得唐糖及時回來罵走了金晶。

sentences.english: Luckily, you reminded me, otherwise I would have missed the train.
sentences.chinese: 虧得你提醒了我，否則我就趕不上火車了。

sentences.english: Someday, someone is going to thank you for having let me go.
sentences.chinese: 會有那麼一天，有人要感謝你，虧得你放走了我。

sentences.english: But Emmy had always been good and attentive to him.
sentences.chinese: 還虧得埃米總是對他很和藹很殷勤。

sentences.english: Fancy a big boy like you not understanding such a simple thing!
sentences.chinese: 虧得你長這麼大，那麼點事兒都不懂。
